translated: Seeing that, all kinds of thoughts arise in my mind.

original: gcig pa nyid kyis 'gro ba mngon par 'du ba mi nus pas //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid kyis 'gro ba mngon par 'du ba mi nus pas //
translated: Because of oneness, it is not possible to bring the world together.

original: nges par yid skyes @169b mda' rnams kyis ni bdag nyid gnyis su byas //
analyzed: nges par yid skyes @169b mda' rnams kyis ni bdag nyid gnyis su byas //
translated: Certainly, the mind-born ones have made a double self.

original: de nas bzhad gad can rnams kyis ded dpon 'di nya dang 'dra bar gyur pa zhes bya ba 'dod bar gyur pa res ma'i gtso mo la 'di skad ces smras par gyur te /
analyzed: de nas bzhad gad can rnams kyis ded dpon 'di nya dang 'dra bar gyur pa zhes bya ba 'dod bar gyur pa res ma'i gtso mo la 'di skad ces smras par gyur te /
translated: Then the chief of the fickle ones, the leader of the fickle ones, said this to the captain, who had become like a fish:

original: me tog yid 'ong mngon par 'byung bas ljon shing ltar //
analyzed: me tog yid 'ong mngon par 'byung bas ljon shing ltar //
translated: Like a tree with beautiful flowers blooming,

original: rang gi gzi brjid kyis ni nor bu'i thur ma ltar //
analyzed: rang gi gzi brjid kyis ni nor bu'i thur ma ltar //
translated: Like a jeweler's probe with its own brilliance,

original: nye bar gnas par byed pa'i mdzes pa 'di yis ni //
analyzed: nye bar gnas par byed pa'i mdzes pa 'di yis ni //
translated: With this beauty that causes one to abide,

original: mtshan mo zla ba ltar ni khyod ni rnam par mdzes //
analyzed: mtshan mo zla ba ltar ni khyod ni rnam par mdzes //
translated: You are beautiful like the moon in the night.

original: de nas legs 'gros res ma'i gtso mo de dang lhan cig tu dga' ba nyams su myong ba ste tho rangs kyi dus na stong phrag brgya'i rin thang mu tig gi har byin par gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas legs 'gros res ma'i gtso mo de dang lhan cig tu dga' ba nyams su myong ba ste tho rangs kyi dus na stong phrag brgya'i rin thang mu tig gi har byin par gyur ro //
translated: Then, when he had enjoyed himself with the chief courtesan, at dawn he gave her a pearl worth a hundred thousand gold coins.

original: gnyis ba'i zhag la gser gyi rgyan chas mngon par brgyan par gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ba'i zhag la gser gyi rgyan chas mngon par brgyan par gyur ro //
translated: On the second day, he was adorned with golden ornaments.

original: gsum pa'i zhag la dngul gyi rang bzhin rgyan rnams nyung ba rab tu byin par gyur to //
analyzed: gsum pa'i zhag la dngul gyi rang bzhin rgyan rnams nyung ba rab tu byin par gyur to //
translated: On the third day, he gave her silver ornaments.

original: de nas res ma'i gtso mo des kun nas nye bar 'ongs te khro ba dang ldan pa rgyal po tshangs pas byin la gtam de zhus shing gsol bar gyur pa /
analyzed: de nas res ma'i gtso mo des kun nas nye bar 'ongs te khro ba dang ldan pa rgyal po tshangs pas byin la gtam de zhus shing gsol bar gyur pa /
translated: Then the chief courtesan came to King Brahmadatta, angry, and told him what had happened:

original: bdag gis nye bar spyad pa bcos ma yin //
analyzed: bdag gis nye bar spyad pa bcos ma yin //
translated: “My enjoyment is artificial.

original: nyi ma re rer lhag par byed 'gyur te //
analyzed: nyi ma re rer lhag par byed 'gyur te //
translated: Day after day it gets worse.

original: de lta na yang des ni mi shes slar //
analyzed: de lta na yang des ni mi shes slar //
translated: Still, he doesn’t understand.

original: legs 'gro mnyes gshin med yid ci yi phyir //
analyzed: legs 'gro mnyes gshin med yid ci yi phyir //
translated: What is the mind of this unloving Sucandra like?”

original: de nas rgyal po des legs 'gro la bos nas //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po des legs 'gro la bos nas //
translated: Then the king called Sucandra and said,🔽“What is this?”

original: gdan kun nas 'dzin par byas pa'i de la res ma'i gtso mo slad pa de bshad cing zhugs so //🔽res ma'i gtso mos gsol ba /
analyzed: gdan kun nas 'dzin par byas pa'i de la res ma'i gtso mo slad pa de bshad cing zhugs so // res ma'i gtso mos gsol ba /
translated: The king, having heard this, said to the chief courtesan, I have been deceived by you.

original: lha lags ma nyes gshin pa med pa'i yid 'di smod par byas pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: lha lags ma nyes gshin pa med pa'i yid 'di smod par byas pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: The chief courtesan said, Your Majesty, what is the use of reproaching this innocent mind?

original: ngo tsha bral ba skyon med pa yi skye po la //
analyzed: ngo tsha bral ba skyon med pa yi skye po la //
translated: For people who are shameless and free from faults,

original: gang zhig shin tu drang ba'i phyir ni dga' rnams smra //
analyzed: gang zhig shin tu drang ba'i phyir ni dga' rnams smra //
translated: who are very honest, speak of their love,

original: don med kun nas nyon mongs pas ni khyab pa'i yid //
analyzed: don med kun nas nyon mongs pas ni khyab pa'i yid //
translated: and whose minds are pervaded by the afflictions of uselessness,

original: des ni chu med pa la zam pa 'dzugs par byed //
analyzed: des ni chu med pa la zam pa 'dzugs par byed //
translated: build bridges where there are no rivers.

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said,

original: ded dpon chen po 'o na 'di la lan thob cig zer ro //
analyzed: ded dpon chen po 'o na 'di la lan thob cig zer ro //
translated: Great caravan leader, then give me an answer to this.

original: legs 'gros gsol pa /
analyzed: legs 'gros gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: btsong bya brtag la bdag cag ni //
analyzed: btsong bya brtag la bdag cag ni //
translated: We are to examine what is to be sold.

original: rgyal po chen po mdzes pa'i blo //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po mdzes pa'i blo //
translated: Great King, your mind is beautiful.

original: res ma'i gtso mo'i btsong bya 'di //
analyzed: res ma'i gtso mo'i btsong bya 'di //
translated: This to-be-sold chief courtesan

original: rang bzhin gzhan gyi skyon dang bcas //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan gyi skyon dang bcas //
translated: has a nature with other's faults.

original: ji ltar 'di yi mdzes ldan dang po'i zhag la 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di yi mdzes ldan dang po'i zhag la 'gyur //
translated: How will she become beautiful in the first watch of the night?

original: de ltar gnyis ba la ni lus 'di ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar gnyis ba la ni lus 'di ma mthong ngo //
translated: In the same way, in the second case, the body is not seen.

original: gzugs ni gzhan pa thob pa 'di la mthong nas ni //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzhan pa thob pa 'di la mthong nas ni //
translated: But when the other form is obtained, it is seen.

original: rgyan ni ster ba rgyan rnams gzhan ni bdag gis byas //
analyzed: rgyan ni ster ba rgyan rnams gzhan ni bdag gis byas //
translated: The ornament is given, the other ornaments are made by me.

original: gser gyi sbram bu min pa ji srid me yis @170a * //
analyzed: gser gyi sbram bu min pa ji srid me yis @170a * //
translated: As long as the gold is not a bracelet,

original: ni ; / rab tu gdung byas de srid shin tu 'od gsal ba //
analyzed: ni ; / rab tu gdung byas de srid shin tu 'od gsal ba //
translated: it is heated by the fire, and as long as it is very bright,

original: bsreg lugs za ba 'bar ba la ni zhugs byas pa //
analyzed: bsreg lugs za ba 'bar ba la ni zhugs byas pa //
translated: it is put into the burning furnace.

original: dri ma can nyid nges par kun nas 'ongs pa yin //
analyzed: dri ma can nyid nges par kun nas 'ongs pa yin //
translated: The impurity itself is definitely all-encompassing.

original: skye bos kyang ni de srid yid 'ong nyer 'gro ba //
analyzed: skye bos kyang ni de srid yid 'ong nyer 'gro ba //
translated: As long as it is pleasing to people and goes near,

original: ji srid shin tu spyod yul du ni nyer 'gro ba ;
analyzed: ji srid shin tu spyod yul du ni nyer 'gro ba ;
translated: as long as it goes near the very object,

original: / song ba longs spyod nye bar 'gro ste skye bo yi //
analyzed: / song ba longs spyod nye bar 'gro ste skye bo yi //
translated: having gone, it approaches enjoyment, and the people

original: skad cig gis ni me tog rnying ltar phyed ltag nyid //
analyzed: skad cig gis ni me tog rnying ltar phyed ltag nyid //
translated: in an instant, like an old flower, turn away.

original: me tog rnam par phye ba dri mas nges 'brel la zhugs nas //
analyzed: me tog rnam par phye ba dri mas nges 'brel la zhugs nas //
translated: Having entered into the connection with the stain of the fully opened flower,

original: bung bas snying po de ni ma dpyad par ni dor bar byed //
analyzed: bung bas snying po de ni ma dpyad par ni dor bar byed //
translated: the bee abandons that essence without examination.

original: phal cher dngos po sar pa chags pa nyid du byed pa ste //
analyzed: phal cher dngos po sar pa chags pa nyid du byed pa ste //
translated: For the most part, it makes new things old.

original: shin tu yid 'ong 'jig rten 'dir ni cung zad yod pa min //
analyzed: shin tu yid 'ong 'jig rten 'dir ni cung zad yod pa min //
translated: There is nothing in this world that is very pleasing.

original: rgas pas gzugs ni mig la ngal so byed cing 'phrog pa ste //
analyzed: rgas pas gzugs ni mig la ngal so byed cing 'phrog pa ste //
translated: Old age robs the eye of its delight in form.

original: chags pa stobs ldan rnams kyi stobs kyang sems la gnod par byed //
analyzed: chags pa stobs ldan rnams kyi stobs kyang sems la gnod par byed //
translated: It weakens the power of the powerful.

original: tshe ni zil gyis mnan nas de bzhin ma spyad mthar byad pa //
analyzed: tshe ni zil gyis mnan nas de bzhin ma spyad mthar byad pa //
translated: It destroys life and brings about the end of enjoyment.

original: rgyal srid zas dang 'od rnams ltar ni dngos po skad cig ma //
analyzed: rgyal srid zas dang 'od rnams ltar ni dngos po skad cig ma //
translated: Like food, light, and a kingdom, things are momentary.

original: de ltar rga dang na dang 'chi dang 'pho ba'i sdug bsngal gyi //
analyzed: de ltar rga dang na dang 'chi dang 'pho ba'i sdug bsngal gyi //
translated: Thus, the arrows of the suffering of old age, sickness, death, and change

original: mda' rnams phog pas sems kyi brtan pa lhod par byas pa la //
analyzed: mda' rnams phog pas sems kyi brtan pa lhod par byas pa la //
translated: pierce the mind and loosen its firmness.

original: bud med ces bya rus pa'i khyim na rang bzhin mig gtsang pa //
analyzed: bud med ces bya rus pa'i khyim na rang bzhin mig gtsang pa //
translated: Seeing a woman, a house of bones, with eyes of flesh,

original: mthong nas yon tan gang mthong nas ni byis pa chags pa bskyed //
analyzed: mthong nas yon tan gang mthong nas ni byis pa chags pa bskyed //
translated: the foolish generate attachment, seeing her qualities.

original: ae ma gzugs ldan bud med ces //
analyzed: ae ma gzugs ldan bud med ces //
translated: “Ah! She has a beautiful form!”

original: rmongs pas kun nas rmongs par gyur //
analyzed: rmongs pas kun nas rmongs par gyur //
translated: Through delusion, they are completely deluded.

original: rus pa'i phreng ba zhes bya 'di //
analyzed: rus pa'i phreng ba zhes bya 'di //
translated: This so-called garland of bones

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis smad pa ste //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis smad pa ste //
translated: is despised by the wise.

original: bud med dga' bar gyur pa yang //
analyzed: bud med dga' bar gyur pa yang //
translated: Even women who delight in it🔽are not free from the suffering of death.

original: de ltar skyon mar shes byas nas //
analyzed: de ltar skyon mar shes byas nas //
translated: Having understood this fault,

original: blo ldan rnams kyis ring du spangs //
analyzed: blo ldan rnams kyis ring du spangs //
translated: the wise should abandon it from afar.

original: ma la ti shing khyis mya ngas ltar //
analyzed: ma la ti shing khyis mya ngas ltar //
translated: Like a dog that has lost its bone,

original: de nas rgyal po des legs so legs so zhes bya bas byang chub sems dpa' la mngon par bstod cing bzhugs so //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po des legs so legs so zhes bya bas byang chub sems dpa' la mngon par bstod cing bzhugs so //
translated: Then the king, with the words Excellent, excellent, praised the bodhisattva.

original: res ma'i gtso mo de yang lang tsho dang gzugs kyi nga rgyal dang rnam par bral nas rab tu zhi bal rtse gcig pa byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: res ma'i gtso mo de yang lang tsho dang gzugs kyi nga rgyal dang rnam par bral nas rab tu zhi bal rtse gcig pa byung bar gyur to //
translated: And that chief courtesan, free from the pride of youth and beauty, became one-pointed in tranquility.

original: skye bo'i tshogs de yang bag med pa rnam par bzlog par tshul khrims su byed pa'i rgyu bdag nyid zhugs shing gnas so //
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs de yang bag med pa rnam par bzlog par tshul khrims su byed pa'i rgyu bdag nyid zhugs shing gnas so //
translated: And that assembly of people, having turned away from heedlessness, became the cause for engaging in and abiding in ethical conduct.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang slar ljon shing gi brag nyid du song bar gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang slar ljon shing gi brag nyid du song bar gyur to //
translated: And the bodhisattva returned to the rock of the wish-fulfilling tree.

original: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das des so so'i skye bo nyid du gnas par gyur pa na yang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyis chags pa'i me rnam par zlog par byed cing rab tu zhi ba'i cho ga @170b la skye po rnam par bzhugs par mdzad do
analyzed: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das des so so'i skye bo nyid du gnas par gyur pa na yang 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyis chags pa'i me rnam par zlog par byed cing rab tu zhi ba'i cho ga @170b la skye po rnam par bzhugs par mdzad do
translated: Thus, even when that Bhagavān was an ordinary person, he, through his freedom from desire, extinguished the fire of passion and established the people in the rite of complete peace.

original: zhes bya ba rnam par bsams nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mchog tu dad pa skyed par 'os zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnam par bsams nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mchog tu dad pa skyed par 'os zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having reflected in this way, one should generate supreme faith in the Buddha, the Bhagavān.

original: ded dpon legs 'gro'i skyes pa'i rabs te skyes rabs dang po'o /
analyzed: ded dpon legs 'gro'i skyes pa'i rabs te skyes rabs dang po'o /
translated: This is the Jātakamālā of Āryaśūra, the first Jātaka.

original: // / mkhas pa rnams ni rtsva nyag kyang bsrung ste //🔽gzhan gyis bkag pa 'bad pa chen po yis //
analyzed: // / mkhas pa rnams ni rtsva nyag kyang bsrung ste // gzhan gyis bkag pa 'bad pa chen po yis //
translated: The wise protect even a blade of grass,🔽not to speak of a living being.🔽The wise, whose chief quality is effortless wisdom,

original: ngal ba med pa'i shes rab gtso bo rnams //🔽srog chags gzhag pa la ni smos ci dgos //
analyzed: ngal ba med pa'i shes rab gtso bo rnams // srog chags gzhag pa la ni smos ci dgos //
translated: are not hindered by great effort.

original: 'di ltar rjes su thos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su thos te /
translated: Thus I have heard:

original: dngul gyi ka ba bkrus pa dang rjes su mthun pa khab dang bcas pa'i rtse mo'i mdun nas lhung ba kun nas rnying par byas pa'i chu 'dzin pa dang / mu tig gi phye ma'i tshogs ltar dkar ba'i steng du rngon pa rnams kyi tshogs kyis g-yag rgod rnams kyi rkang rjes kyi shul gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang /
analyzed: dngul gyi ka ba bkrus pa dang rjes su mthun pa khab dang bcas pa'i rtse mo'i mdun nas lhung ba kun nas rnying par byas pa'i chu 'dzin pa dang / mu tig gi phye ma'i tshogs ltar dkar ba'i steng du rngon pa rnams kyi tshogs kyis g-yag rgod rnams kyi rkang rjes kyi shul gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang /
translated: The water was clear like a crystal pillar, and the water was old, as if it had been poured from the front of a needle with a silver handle.🔽The mountain was white like a pile of pearl powder, and the hunters followed the tracks of the wild yaks.

original: dbang phyug chen po'i khyu mchog gi rvas brdungs pas sna tshogs pa'i ri bo'i lto ba mi mnyam par bcas pa dang / grog dang sar la dang thang shing dang na me ru dang padma can rnams kyi nags du mas ri'i sul rnams sngo bar byas pa dang /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i khyu mchog gi rvas brdungs pas sna tshogs pa'i ri bo'i lto ba mi mnyam par bcas pa dang / grog dang sar la dang thang shing dang na me ru dang padma can rnams kyi nags du mas ri'i sul rnams sngo bar byas pa dang /
translated: The mountain was uneven with the horns of Shiva's bull, and the mountain's valleys were green with many forests of juniper, salla, pine, and padmaka trees.

original: ri las 'bab pa'i chu rab tu 'gro bas rtsa ba'i sa bkrus pa dang / mtshan mo'i dus na rab tu 'bar ba'i sman chen po nyid kyis mar me stong phrag byas pa dang 'dra ba dang / rig pa 'dzin pa pho mos kun nas longs spyod pas mtsho'i 'gram gyi mthar ljon shing rnams kyi khyim gyi bar dri zhim par byas pa dang /
analyzed: ri las 'bab pa'i chu rab tu 'gro bas rtsa ba'i sa bkrus pa dang / mtshan mo'i dus na rab tu 'bar ba'i sman chen po nyid kyis mar me stong phrag byas pa dang 'dra ba dang / rig pa 'dzin pa pho mos kun nas longs spyod pas mtsho'i 'gram gyi mthar ljon shing rnams kyi khyim gyi bar dri zhim par byas pa dang /
translated: The water falling from the mountains cleanses the ground, and at night it is like a thousand lamps burning with the great herbs that blaze with light. The trees on the banks of the lake are perfumed by the houses of the male and female knowledge holders who enjoy them.

original: 'ga' zhig tu gnya' ral can rnams kyi stobs kyis brgyan pas rnam par lhung bar byas pa'i 'jigs shing rab tu 'pho ba'i khri snyan sa le dang / ri dags rnams kyi rkang rjes gzhag pa rtsva rtsa nas bton pa dang / 'ga' zhig tu lha mo au ma'i zhabs kyi mthil la rgya skyegs kyi khu bas mtshan pa'i rtsva sngon pos ljang gu'i sa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu gnya' ral can rnams kyi stobs kyis brgyan pas rnam par lhung bar byas pa'i 'jigs shing rab tu 'pho ba'i khri snyan sa le dang / ri dags rnams kyi rkang rjes gzhag pa rtsva rtsa nas bton pa dang / 'ga' zhig tu lha mo au ma'i zhabs kyi mthil la rgya skyegs kyi khu bas mtshan pa'i rtsva sngon pos ljang gu'i sa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: In some places, the ground is terrifying and shifting, with thrones of the nāgas fallen by the power of the rākṣasas, and with the footprints of deer that have pulled up the grass by the roots. In some places, the ground is green with blue grass marked with red dye on the soles of the feet of the goddess Umā.

original: gzhan du 'dab chags rnams kyi mchus dum bur byas pa'i yongs su smin ba'i shing rnams kyi 'bras bus khyab pa'i skyed mos tshal gzhan dang ldan pa dang / rlung gis rnam par rgyas par gyur pa'i khyad par mang ba'i me tog rnams kyi dris dri zhim pa dang /🔽dpyid ka 'i zla ba nas rab tu brtsams pa'i shing rnams kyis kha zlum pa'i myu gu dang ldan ba dang / ri dags rnam par lhung ba'i sgras 'jigs pa'i 'dab chags kyi tshogs kyis rnam par grol bar gyur ba'i chu bo gang g'a'i 'gram gyi chu dang ldan pa dang @171a * //
analyzed: gzhan du 'dab chags rnams kyi mchus dum bur byas pa'i yongs su smin ba'i shing rnams kyi 'bras bus khyab pa'i skyed mos tshal gzhan dang ldan pa dang / rlung gis rnam par rgyas par gyur pa'i khyad par mang ba'i me tog rnams kyi dris dri zhim pa dang / dpyid ka 'i zla ba nas rab tu brtsams pa'i shing rnams kyis kha zlum pa'i myu gu dang ldan ba dang / ri dags rnam par lhung ba'i sgras 'jigs pa'i 'dab chags kyi tshogs kyis rnam par grol bar gyur ba'i chu bo gang g'a'i 'gram gyi chu dang ldan pa dang @171a * //
translated: In other places, the forest was filled with the fruit of fully ripened trees, pecked at by the beaks of birds. The forest was fragrant with the scent of many different flowers, opened by the wind.🔽The trees, beginning to sprout buds in the spring, were like the faces of women. The forest was filled with the sounds of birds frightened by the falling of deer into the water of the Ganges.

original: sgeg pa dang bcas par mi 'am ci pho mo'i glu thos pas /
analyzed: sgeg pa dang bcas par mi 'am ci pho mo'i glu thos pas /
translated: The forest was filled with the sounds of the songs of the male and female kinnaras.

original: ri dags kyi tshogs mi g-yo ba yod pa dang / rtse mo mtho ba nyid kyis 'o ma'i rgya mtsho ltar mthon po nyid du nye bar song ba'i ri po gangs can gyi phyogs gcig na gus pa dang bcas pa ltar shing rnams kyis mchod pa'i sgo brag gi rgyab dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: ri dags kyi tshogs mi g-yo ba yod pa dang / rtse mo mtho ba nyid kyis 'o ma'i rgya mtsho ltar mthon po nyid du nye bar song ba'i ri po gangs can gyi phyogs gcig na gus pa dang bcas pa ltar shing rnams kyis mchod pa'i sgo brag gi rgyab dang ldan pa dang /
translated: In a certain part of the snowy mountains, which are like the ocean of milk, high and unmoving, with herds of deer and lofty peaks, there is a great cave, which is like a respectful worshipper, with a rocky back.

original: rtsva'i myu gu ljang gu byung pas mtha' ma sngo ba dang / padma rnam par rgyas pa'i mtshos nye 'khor brgyan pa'i shin tu che ba'i phug tu lhag par gnas shing /
analyzed: rtsva'i myu gu ljang gu byung pas mtha' ma sngo ba dang / padma rnam par rgyas pa'i mtshos nye 'khor brgyan pa'i shin tu che ba'i phug tu lhag par gnas shing /
translated: The outer edges are blue with the sprouting of green shoots, and it is adorned with nearby lakes with blooming lotuses.

original: shin tu mang ba'i bung ba'i chus mngon par spangs pa'i gos kyi rgyu spun kun nas ser ba'i gnya' ral gyis gnya' bar sgeg pa dang / ze'u 'bru ltar 'jam zhing shin tu g-yo ba'i lce dang ldan pa dang / cung zad kun nas rnyings pa'i aa ti mu kta'i me tog gi phung po ltar kun nas skya ba'i lus dang ldan pa dang /

original: gnya' ral dang ni rgyab bzung nas //🔽yang yang de yi steng zhon nas //🔽lhan skyes g-yo ba las ring bar //
analyzed: gnya' ral dang ni rgyab bzung nas // yang yang de yi steng zhon nas // lhan skyes g-yo ba las ring bar //
translated: holding his mane and his back.

original: byung zhing byung nas lhung bar gyur //
analyzed: byung zhing byung nas lhung bar gyur //
translated: She was born from the womb, and having been born, she fell.

original: mdun du yod bzhin rnams la yang //
analyzed: mdun du yod bzhin rnams la yang //
translated: Even though they were in front of her,

original: 'bras bu mang ba de dag gis /
analyzed: 'bras bu mang ba de dag gis /
translated: she was not satisfied with the many fruits🔽of the trees.

original: za 'dod de yi kha las ni //
analyzed: za 'dod de yi kha las ni //
translated: which was open in desire to eat,

original: 'bras bu kun nas 'gugs par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu kun nas 'gugs par 'gyur //
translated: the fruit was drawn out completely.

original: de ltar spre'u phrug de dag gi //🔽bya ba ngan pa de dang de //
analyzed: de ltar spre'u phrug de dag gi // bya ba ngan pa de dang de //
translated: In this way, the Bodhisattva,

original: snying rje bzang po'i sems ldan phyir //🔽bu dag ltar ni des bzod gyur //
analyzed: snying rje bzang po'i sems ldan phyir // bu dag ltar ni des bzod gyur //
translated: endowed with a compassionate and good mind,🔽forgave the bad actions

original: kun nas mnyam pa'i sems ldan pa //🔽bde dang sdug bsngal ma ltos pa'i //
analyzed: kun nas mnyam pa'i sems ldan pa // bde dang sdug bsngal ma ltos pa'i //
translated: of those monkey-children, as if they were his own sons.

original: kun gtso dam pa rnams kyi yid //
analyzed: kun gtso dam pa rnams kyi yid //
translated: The mind of the best of all,🔽who is endowed with an impartial mind,🔽is never tired,

original: gang du yang ni ngal mi 'gyur //🔽de nas dus gcig gi tshe na kun nas rtsub cing gshog pa'i tshogs rgyas pa 'khyog cing rtsub pa'i sen mo'i rtse mo dang ldan pa rang bzhin gyis drag pa'i mig can gang du yang sha'i @173a * //
analyzed: gang du yang ni ngal mi 'gyur // de nas dus gcig gi tshe na kun nas rtsub cing gshog pa'i tshogs rgyas pa 'khyog cing rtsub pa'i sen mo'i rtse mo dang ldan pa rang bzhin gyis drag pa'i mig can gang du yang sha'i @173a * //
translated: no matter where he is,🔽whether he is happy or suffering.

original: zas ma rnyed pa nam mkha'i mthil du kun nas 'khor te /
analyzed: zas ma rnyed pa nam mkha'i mthil du kun nas 'khor te /
translated: Then, at one time, a vulture, whose wings were fully grown and rough, whose claws were sharp and rough, whose eyes were naturally fierce, who had not found any flesh to eat anywhere, was flying around in the sky.

original: rno ba'i spu gri ltar mchu rno ba spu gri can zhes bya ba'i bya rgod sgra dang bcas shing shugs dang ldan pa ma dpyad par byung ste /
analyzed: rno ba'i spu gri ltar mchu rno ba spu gri can zhes bya ba'i bya rgod sgra dang bcas shing shugs dang ldan pa ma dpyad par byung ste /
translated: The vulture named Sharp-Beak, with a beak as sharp as a razor, came with a sound and speed, without any analysis.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la nye bar 'jug pa 'bras bu myang bas skyod cing dkar la srab pa'i so'i phreng ba dang ldan pa'i spre'u'i phru gu dag 'jigs pas kha phye zhing rnam par 'gyur ba'i gdong pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la nye bar 'jug pa 'bras bu myang bas skyod cing dkar la srab pa'i so'i phreng ba dang ldan pa'i spre'u'i phru gu dag 'jigs pas kha phye zhing rnam par 'gyur ba'i gdong pa dang ldan pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva was approached by young monkeys with faces of fear, mouths open, and eyes rolling, with rows of teeth white and thin, shaking from the taste of the fruit.

original: skad shin tu rtsub pa dag gis bzung nas shin tu myur bar bar snang la 'phur te kha ba can gyi ri'i rtse mor gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: skad shin tu rtsub pa dag gis bzung nas shin tu myur bar bar snang la 'phur te kha ba can gyi ri'i rtse mor gnas par gyur to //
translated: The Bodhisattva was seized by the monkeys with very rough voices, and they flew very quickly into the sky and landed on the peak of the snowy mountain.

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang kyi hud kyi hud ces bya ba brjod nas gal te bdag gis bya rgod 'di rnam par gnon pas brnyas par gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang kyi hud kyi hud ces bya ba brjod nas gal te bdag gis bya rgod 'di rnam par gnon pas brnyas par gyur na /
translated: The Bodhisattva also said, Alas, alas! If I were to overpower these vultures,

original: slar 'di'i phur nas shin tu dka' ba'i rtse mo gzhan la gnas nas mchongs shing 'gro ba'i phru gu gnyis po 'di bsad par gyur na rnam pa thams cad du spre'u'i phru gu gnyis po 'di bdag gis blta bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: slar 'di'i phur nas shin tu dka' ba'i rtse mo gzhan la gnas nas mchongs shing 'gro ba'i phru gu gnyis po 'di bsad par gyur na rnam pa thams cad du spre'u'i phru gu gnyis po 'di bdag gis blta bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: If these two little monkeys, who live in the treetops and leap from branch to branch, were to be killed, I would never be able to look at these two little monkeys again.

original: mngon par 'phel ba'i sdug bsngal gyis khyab mig ldan pa //🔽skad ni rtsub pas rkan gyi bug mtshon byas pa //🔽lto ba las 'dzag khrag gis spu ni brlan byas pa //
analyzed: mngon par 'phel ba'i sdug bsngal gyis khyab mig ldan pa // skad ni rtsub pas rkan gyi bug mtshon byas pa // lto ba las 'dzag khrag gis spu ni brlan byas pa //
translated: They are covered with the suffering of manifest growth.🔽Their voices are harsh, as if their throats were pierced.

original: bkres pa dang ldan khra ltar sha ni rnam 'jig pa //🔽bya rgod 'dis ni sha ni rnam par gcod pa yis //
analyzed: bkres pa dang ldan khra ltar sha ni rnam 'jig pa // bya rgod 'dis ni sha ni rnam par gcod pa yis //
translated: Their fur is wet with blood dripping from their bellies.🔽They are hungry, and the vulture is tearing at their flesh.

original: shin tu spre'u'i phru gu gnyis po 'di la ni//🔽'bras bu rnams ni blangs nas de dag 'ongs pa yi //
analyzed: shin tu spre'u'i phru gu gnyis po 'di la ni// 'bras bu rnams ni blangs nas de dag 'ongs pa yi //
translated: This vulture is cutting up the flesh of these two little monkeys.🔽Today, in front of them,

original: mdun du de ring bdag gis smra bar nus sam ci //
analyzed: mdun du de ring bdag gis smra bar nus sam ci //
translated: can I say anything?

original: g-yo ba dag ni mtsho chu 'thungs pas 'gyur ram ci //
analyzed: g-yo ba dag ni mtsho chu 'thungs pas 'gyur ram ci //
translated: Can I make the water in the lake move?

original: 'bras bu'i don du shing la 'dzegs nas gnas sam ci //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i don du shing la 'dzegs nas gnas sam ci //
translated: Or did they climb a tree for the sake of fruit and fall?

original: yang na ri yi phug 'dir zhugs par gyur tam ci //
analyzed: yang na ri yi phug 'dir zhugs par gyur tam ci //
translated: Or did they enter this mountain cave?

original: 'on te sbrul 'ga' zhig gis 'dir ni de dag bsad //
analyzed: 'on te sbrul 'ga' zhig gis 'dir ni de dag bsad //
translated: Or were they killed by some snake here?

original: ri dags bdag po khyed ni thur lta mi smra gnas pa ci //
analyzed: ri dags bdag po khyed ni thur lta mi smra gnas pa ci //
translated: Why do you, O lord of beasts, look down and remain silent?

original: phru gu de 'dir gang du song 'gyur smra bar mdzod //🔽de ltar rab tu mchongs 'gro kun nas phongs mig de dag gis //
analyzed: phru gu de 'dir gang du song 'gyur smra bar mdzod // de ltar rab tu mchongs 'gro kun nas phongs mig de dag gis //
translated: Tell me, where have those cubs gone?🔽How can I listen to them, with eyes that dart hither and thither,

original: 'khrug pa'i tshig ldan ji ltar bdag gis de dag nyan par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i tshig ldan ji ltar bdag gis de dag nyan par 'gyur //
translated: and with words full of agitation?

original: de dag med pa yun ring pos ni nye bar dmigs byas nas //
analyzed: de dag med pa yun ring pos ni nye bar dmigs byas nas //
translated: Having long observed their absence,

original: phru gu kun da ltar ni dkar ba'i so yi phreng bar ldan //
analyzed: phru gu kun da ltar ni dkar ba'i so yi phreng bar ldan //
translated: those cubs, now white as jasmine flowers with rows of teeth,

original: mya ngan gyis ni kun nas nyer 'ongs de dag byas 'gyur te //
analyzed: mya ngan gyis ni kun nas nyer 'ongs de dag byas 'gyur te //
translated: will come near, overcome with grief,

original: mchil pas bzung ba'i nya rnams ltar ni 'dar bar gyur pa rnams //
analyzed: mchil pas bzung ba'i nya rnams ltar ni 'dar bar gyur pa rnams //
translated: trembling like fish caught on a hook.

original: de bas na 'di 'dir dus thob pa bdag gis sems te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di 'dir dus thob pa bdag gis sems te /
translated: Therefore, I think this is the right time for me to do this.

original: ji srid stag gi sen @173b mo'i myu gu'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i mchus ni lto ba rnam phug nas //
analyzed: ji srid stag gi sen @173b mo'i myu gu'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i mchus ni lto ba rnam phug nas //
translated: As long as the vulture, with his beak holding the form of a tiger's claw, tears open the belly,

original: bya rgod 'di ni 'jigs ldan spre'u'i phru gu dag la rgyu ma rnams ni 'gugs mi byed //
analyzed: bya rgod 'di ni 'jigs ldan spre'u'i phru gu dag la rgyu ma rnams ni 'gugs mi byed //
translated: and the eagle, with his terrible beak, pulls out the entrails of the little monkeys,

original: de sred bdag gis song ste kha ba can gyi ri rtse'i mtha' mar mgrin lta'i gdong can 'dug nas ni //
analyzed: de sred bdag gis song ste kha ba can gyi ri rtse'i mtha' mar mgrin lta'i gdong can 'dug nas ni //
translated: I will go to the end of the snowy mountain and, with a voice like a lion,

original: thabs ni sngon 'gro mnyam nyid kyis 'di bdag gis chos dang ma bral gnas pas khrid par 'gyur //
analyzed: thabs ni sngon 'gro mnyam nyid kyis 'di bdag gis chos dang ma bral gnas pas khrid par 'gyur //
translated: I will lead them away by means of the preliminary equality of means, so that they may remain in the Dharma.

original: de ltar rnam par bsams te bdag nyid chen po des bya rgod dang nye bar 'ongs te smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par bsams te bdag nyid chen po des bya rgod dang nye bar 'ongs te smras pa /
translated: Having thus reflected, the Great Being approached the vulture and said:

original: kye 'dab chags kyi mchog bdag gi lag par pha ma dag gis spre'u'i phrug pa 'di dag gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: kye 'dab chags kyi mchog bdag gi lag par pha ma dag gis spre'u'i phrug pa 'di dag gzhag pa ste /
translated: O best of birds, my parents have placed these little monkeys in my hands.

original: de bas na khyod kyis 'di dag kha phye pa'i so rnams kyis phongs pa'i gdong dang ldan pa skad rtsub pa dag bsad par rigs pa ma yin zhes zer te /
analyzed: de bas na khyod kyis 'di dag kha phye pa'i so rnams kyis phongs pa'i gdong dang ldan pa skad rtsub pa dag bsad par rigs pa ma yin zhes zer te /
translated: Therefore, it is not right for you to kill them with your beak, which is like a sword, and with your harsh voice.

original: nges par khyed kyi'ang phru gu rnams //
analyzed: nges par khyed kyi'ang phru gu rnams //
translated: Your children, too, will certainly be like that.

original: sngar ni 'byung ba 'am yod pa ste //🔽ci 'dra khyod kyis de rnams la //
analyzed: sngar ni 'byung ba 'am yod pa ste // ci 'dra khyod kyis de rnams la //
translated: They will be born or exist in the future🔽just as they were in the past.

original: mnyes gshin gzhan yang de lta bu //
analyzed: mnyes gshin gzhan yang de lta bu //
translated: You are kind to them, but they are not kind to you.

original: de ltar snying rje la dmigs nas //
analyzed: de ltar snying rje la dmigs nas //
translated: Thus, having focused on compassion,🔽do not kill the young monkeys.

original: spre'u'i phrug pa ma bsad cig / nad pa 'di dag zos nas kyang //
analyzed: spre'u'i phrug pa ma bsad cig / nad pa 'di dag zos nas kyang //
translated: Even if you eat these sick people,

original: khyed la tshim pa gtan du med //
analyzed: khyed la tshim pa gtan du med //
translated: you will never be satisfied.

original: kyi hud de yi 'tsho ba smad //
analyzed: kyi hud de yi 'tsho ba smad //
translated: Alas, their livelihood is contemptible.

original: 'di 'dra bdag la chags pa smad //
analyzed: 'di 'dra bdag la chags pa smad //
translated: Their attachment to such a body is contemptible.

original: gang zhig lus 'di rgyas pa 'di //
analyzed: gang zhig lus 'di rgyas pa 'di //
translated: This body, which is nourished by this,

original: gzhan la 'tshe bas khyad par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan la 'tshe bas khyad par 'gyur //
translated: is distinguished by its harm to others.

original: mi shes pa ni chags pa skye //
analyzed: mi shes pa ni chags pa skye //
translated: Attachment arises from ignorance.

original: skyon dang bcas pa'i lus la yang //
analyzed: skyon dang bcas pa'i lus la yang //
translated: Even though the body is flawed,

original: de rgyas don du mi shes pas //
analyzed: de rgyas don du mi shes pas //
translated: the ignorant do it for the sake of its nourishment.

original: ngan 'gro'i rgyu yi las ni byed //
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i rgyu yi las ni byed //
translated: They do actions that are the cause of bad rebirths.

original: bdag dang bdag gi med med phyir //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi med med phyir //
translated: Since there is no self and no mine,

original: gang zhig thams cad stong pa mthong //
analyzed: gang zhig thams cad stong pa mthong //
translated: who sees everything as empty?

original: yang dag min ba'i rnam rtog skyes //
analyzed: yang dag min ba'i rnam rtog skyes //
translated: False imagination arises

original: yid kyi mun pa de 'gegs min //
analyzed: yid kyi mun pa de 'gegs min //
translated: and does not block the darkness of the mind.

original: gang tshe mun pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang tshe mun pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: When, because of the absence of darkness,

original: mkhas pas de nyid thob 'gyur na //
analyzed: mkhas pas de nyid thob 'gyur na //
translated: the wise man has attained the truth,

original: de tshe thar pa'i phyir 'gyur te //
analyzed: de tshe thar pa'i phyir 'gyur te //
translated: then he will be liberated,

original: dge mi dge la rgyab kyis phyogs //
analyzed: dge mi dge la rgyab kyis phyogs //
translated: and will turn his back on virtue and vice.

original: seng ge las gzhan sha za su zhig yod min te //
analyzed: seng ge las gzhan sha za su zhig yod min te //
translated: What other flesh-eater is there but the lion?

original: drag pa'am zhes 'di ni sa la gsal ba ste //
analyzed: drag pa'am zhes 'di ni sa la gsal ba ste //
translated: This is clear in the world.

original: seng ge'i skye gnas dka' ba yang ni bdag brten pa //
analyzed: seng ge'i skye gnas dka' ba yang ni bdag brten pa //
translated: I will rely on the difficult birth of a lion.

original: chos las 'das min srog chags 'tshe ba 'di mi 'dod //
analyzed: chos las 'das min srog chags 'tshe ba 'di mi 'dod //
translated: I will not transgress the Dharma, but I will not give up this violence.🔽In this forest, many deer are killed

original: nags 'di las ni ri dags mang po bsten pa dang // ri dags dgras ni bsad pa 'am rang nyid kyis shi ba //
analyzed: nags 'di las ni ri dags mang po bsten pa dang // ri dags dgras ni bsad pa 'am rang nyid kyis shi ba //
translated: by the king of deer, or die of themselves.

original: mkha' 'gro mchog lags nam mkha' 'khor zhing bltas nas ni //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro mchog lags nam mkha' 'khor zhing bltas nas ni //
translated: The supreme sky-wanderer, looking while flying in the sky,

original: myur du 'gro ba 'ongs te de yi sha za 'gyur //
analyzed: myur du 'gro ba 'ongs te de yi sha za 'gyur //
translated: quickly comes and eats their flesh.

original: me yi lce dang 'dra bar lus la gdung byed cing //
analyzed: me yi lce dang 'dra bar lus la gdung byed cing //
translated: The fire of hunger burns the body,

original: bkres pa chen po yang ni de bas bzod byas te //🔽dmyal @174a * //
analyzed: bkres pa chen po yang ni de bas bzod byas te // dmyal @174a * //
translated: and great hunger must be endured.

original: bar nges par lhung ba'i phyir ni mi dge ba //
analyzed: bar nges par lhung ba'i phyir ni mi dge ba //
translated: The non-virtue that definitely causes falling into hell

original: 'di 'dra ba ni bag yod dor bas ma byad cig / nang du sems can rnams kyi rus pa'i tshigs ni chag pas tsheg tsheg sgra yi h'um byed kyis ni 'jigs //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba ni bag yod dor bas ma byad cig / nang du sems can rnams kyi rus pa'i tshigs ni chag pas tsheg tsheg sgra yi h'um byed kyis ni 'jigs //
translated: The bones of the beings in hell are shattered by the cold, and they moan with a sound like “hum.”

original: me stag tshogs ni kun nas rgyas par byed cing me lce chen po dmar zhing 'od med 'jigs par ldan //
analyzed: me stag tshogs ni kun nas rgyas par byed cing me lce chen po dmar zhing 'od med 'jigs par ldan //
translated: The flames of the fire are red and terrifying, and the sparks spread everywhere.

original: g-yo ba'i 'bar ba'i tshogs ldan dmyal ba'i bsreg lugs za ba rnams ni mkhas pa rnams kyis brjod bzhin pa //
analyzed: g-yo ba'i 'bar ba'i tshogs ldan dmyal ba'i bsreg lugs za ba rnams ni mkhas pa rnams kyis brjod bzhin pa //
translated: The wise say that the beings in hell are burned by the fire of the flames that move about.

original: skye bo'i rna bar song ba rnams kyang mi bde byed na kun nas reg pa slar yang smos ci dgos //
analyzed: skye bo'i rna bar song ba rnams kyang mi bde byed na kun nas reg pa slar yang smos ci dgos //
translated: If the mere sound of this is unpleasant to the ear, what can be said of the actual experience?

original: lcags kyi bum pa can la 'bar ba'i bsreg lugs 'dzin pa reg pas kun nas gdung ba la ni mig / shin tu sgra sgrogs bskol ba kun nas bskyod pa'i mar nag gis ni kha dang mgrin pa gang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lcags kyi bum pa can la 'bar ba'i bsreg lugs 'dzin pa reg pas kun nas gdung ba la ni mig / shin tu sgra sgrogs bskol ba kun nas bskyod pa'i mar nag gis ni kha dang mgrin pa gang ba'i phyir //
translated: In the iron pot, the beings are burned by the fire that is held there. Their eyes are filled with the boiling oil that is everywhere agitated and that hisses.

original: rtsig pa la ni ri mo bris pa'i 'tshed bzhin dmyal ba'i mi ni bris ba yang ni mthong byas te //
analyzed: rtsig pa la ni ri mo bris pa'i 'tshed bzhin dmyal ba'i mi ni bris ba yang ni mthong byas te //
translated: And the men of hell, as if painted on a wall, are seen to be painted.

original: ngan 'gro thob phyir rnam par 'tshe byed su zhig kyang ni drag pa'i rang bzhin las ni 'gyod mi byed //
analyzed: ngan 'gro thob phyir rnam par 'tshe byed su zhig kyang ni drag pa'i rang bzhin las ni 'gyod mi byed //
translated: And who, having done harm to others, will not be remorseful, when he has obtained a bad destiny, because of his violent nature?

original: ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal nam mthong nas //
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal nam mthong nas //
translated: When one sees the suffering of the bad destinies,

original: gang zhig mi dge las mi 'gyod //
analyzed: gang zhig mi dge las mi 'gyod //
translated: who will not be remorseful about evil deeds?

original: mi yi rnam pa de la yang //
analyzed: mi yi rnam pa de la yang //
translated: Even in the human condition,

original: yang na rdo ba'i snying can yang //
analyzed: yang na rdo ba'i snying can yang //
translated: or even if one has a heart of stone,

original: de nas bya rgod des byang chub sems dpa'i chos bstan pas dang ba'i blo skyes shing mngon du phyag 'tshal nas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas bya rgod des byang chub sems dpa'i chos bstan pas dang ba'i blo skyes shing mngon du phyag 'tshal nas smras pa /
translated: Then the vulture, having given the Bodhisattva a Dharma teaching, gave rise to a clear mind and, bowing down, said,

original: ri dags kyi bdag bo khyed kyis byis pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsal bar mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: ri dags kyi bdag bo khyed kyis byis pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid gsal bar mdzad pa ste /
translated: “Lord of the animals, you have clearly shown the characteristics of fools.

original: da ni mkhas pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid khyed kyis bshad par 'os so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: da ni mkhas pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid khyed kyis bshad par 'os so zhes zer ro //
translated: Now it is fitting for you to explain the characteristics of the wise.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' dang ba'i yid dang ldan pa shes nas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' dang ba'i yid dang ldan pa shes nas smras pa /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva, knowing that the vulture had a clear mind, said,

original: gal te de lta yin na de bas na mkhas pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid nyon cig ces zer ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na de bas na mkhas pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid nyon cig ces zer ro //
translated: If that is so, then listen to the definition of the wise.

original: rnyed dang ma rnyed pa la phan par smra ba'i grogs po la 'am sdang ba la //
analyzed: rnyed dang ma rnyed pa la phan par smra ba'i grogs po la 'am sdang ba la //
translated: Whether it is a friend who speaks for your benefit or an enemy,

original: bstod pa dang ni smad pa la 'am yo byad che ba la 'am rgud pa la //
analyzed: bstod pa dang ni smad pa la 'am yo byad che ba la 'am rgud pa la //
translated: whether it is praise or blame, whether you are prosperous or in decline,🔽he who does not change his mind, which is pure with the peace of mind,

original: gang zhig nye bar zhi bas rnam par dag pa'i yid kyis rnam par 'gyur mi 'gro / de ni shes rab can rnams kyi ni steng gnas 'od zer ldan rnams kyi ni nyi ma bzhin //
analyzed: gang zhig nye bar zhi bas rnam par dag pa'i yid kyis rnam par 'gyur mi 'gro / de ni shes rab can rnams kyi ni steng gnas 'od zer ldan rnams kyi ni nyi ma bzhin //
translated: he is the wise one, like the sun among the stars.

original: yang na mkhas pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid thos pa 'dis khyod la ci zhig bya ste //
analyzed: yang na mkhas pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid thos pa 'dis khyod la ci zhig bya ste //
translated: Or what will you do with this definition of the wise that you have heard?🔽Let go of these little monkeys.

original: spre'u'i phru gu 'di dag rnam par btang bar gyis shig / bdag nyid kho na bdag gis khyod la rab tu sbyin par bya zhes zer //
analyzed: spre'u'i phru gu 'di dag rnam par btang bar gyis shig / bdag nyid kho na bdag gis khyod la rab tu sbyin par bya zhes zer //
translated: I will give you myself alone.

original: khyed kyis sha ni zo shig khrag kyang btung bar @174b gyis //
analyzed: khyed kyis sha ni zo shig khrag kyang btung bar @174b gyis //
translated: Eat my flesh and drink my blood.

original: g-yo ba med pa bdag gi mig dag kyang thon cig / de ltar smras nas rnam par 'dzums dang bral ba'i mig can de //

analyzed: 'brel bas rang gi khyim du song ba sgeg pa dang bcas par phag gi sha ni nye bar sbyar nas tshil dang 'brel pa ni //

analyzed: bya rgod kyang ni rang gi tshang du myur du song bar gyur //

analyzed: gser ri'i rtse mor 'od zer gsal ba la ni gnas gyur na //

analyzed: shing gi yal ga rnams kyis tshang la gnas pa'i 'dab chags bskyod pa yis //

translated: Seeing the young monkeys, their bodies pierced by the claws of the vultures, fallen unconscious,

analyzed: chu yi 'gram rten 'dab chags rnams kyis bkag pa ni //
translated: The birds on the bank of the water, being obstructed,

analyzed: kun nas ze'u 'bru kham pa'i mtshor ni rnam zhugs gyur //

analyzed: mtsho chen po der rnam par zhugs nas kyang //
translated: Having entered that great lake,

analyzed: myur du brgyal te rnam 'phyar gnya' ral can //

analyzed: bya rgod sen mo rnon mos yan lag breg / de nas yal ga'i ri dags phrug de dag / steng du myur bar ge sar dang bcas pa'i //

analyzed: chu ni 'dzag pa gnya' ral can gyis blugs //

analyzed: kun nas bskyod pa'i 'dab ma ltar ni yid 'phrog lce yis ni //

analyzed: shing rnams kyi yal ga la 'jug cing bskyod pa'i rma bya'i mjug sgro'i tshogs kyis yid shin tu 'phrog pa'i nags kyi nang dang ldan pa mtshan mo 'das pa la brag phug dang nye bar ljon shing gel pa'i me tog gi mthar kun nas spyod pa'i bung ba'i
translated: Near the cave, at the end of the flowers of the bushes and trees, the bees,
